data.title: Chief Ministers of Kerala(1957-2023): Tenure, All CM List, Party
data.meta_description: Pinarayi Vijayan is the current CM of Kerala. Check the list of Kerala CM from below table with tenure and party name.
data.text:
Pinarayi Vijayan is the current CM of Kerala. Kerala CM is the head of state governance and administration. As per Article 164, the governor appoints both the Chief Minister and other ministers. Below is the list of CM of Kerala with tenure and party names.

Chief Ministers of Kerala

In Kerala, the Chief Minister is the main leader in charge. The governor picks the Chief Minister, who leads a team of ministers accountable to the assembly. Pinarayi Vijayan from CPIM is the present chief minister of Kerala. Currently, he is serving his second term as the Honorable Chief Minister of Kerala from 20th May 2021.

Kerala is the most educated state in India with a literacy rate of 94 percent. It is located in the southwestern part of India. It covers an area of approx. 38 square kilometers. According to the 2011 Census, Kerala has around 33 million population in total. The nation’s legislative assembly is composed of 140 seats and 20 seats in the Lok Sabha.

Below is the list of Chief Ministers of Kerala.

Present Chief Minister of Kerala – Pinarayi Vijayan

Pinarayi Vijayan is the current CM of Kerala. He was born on 21st March 1944 in Pinarayi, Kerala. After completing his early education, he studied at Government Brennen College in Thalassery. Vijayan started his political journey in student activities at the college and joined the Communist Party in 1964. During the emergency from 1975 to 1977, he confronted detention and torture.

In his ministerial function, he focused on energy and cooperation, contributing to the state’s increased power-era capacity. He was elected to the Kerala Assembly in multiple instances from distinct constituencies. He’s regarded for specializing in social welfare (Housing Schemes, Financial Aid) and improvement all through his management. His government has worked on problems like women’s empowerment, healthcare, schooling, and infrastructure.

Below are the contact details of present CM Pinarayi Vijayan.

Deputy Chief Minister of Kerala

The designation of deputy chief minister is not specifed in the Constitution of India. Deputy chief ministers are the second highest ranking member in the Council of Ministers of Kerala state. Till now there are three persons who have served as deputy chief minister. Here are those three ministers who served as deputy chief minister of Kerala state.

Name

Tenure

Political Party

Raman Sankar

22nd February 1960 – 26th September 1962

Indian National Congress

CH Mohammed Koya

28th December 1981 – 17th March 1982

Indian Union Muslim League

(IUML)

24th May 1982 – 28th September 1983

Indian Union Muslim League (IUML)

K . Avukader Kutty Naha

24th October 1983 – 25th March 1987

Indian Union Muslim League (IUML)

As of 25th March, 1987, there is no incumbent Deputy Chief Minister in the current government, and the position remains unfilled.

First Chief Minister of Kerala

E. M. S. Namboodiripad is the first chief minister of Kerala. He was born on 13th June, 1909 in Perintalmanna, British India. He was a well known Indian politician from the CPI(M) from Kerala. He became the first Chief Minister of Kerala in 1957. Aside from his political contributions, EMS was a prolific writer. He wrote so many books on political, economic, and social issues related to Kerala State.

Name

E. M. S. Namboodiripad

Born

13th June, 1909

Political Party

CPI(M)

Chief Minister Term

5th March, 1957 – 31st July , 1959

Significance

First Chief Minister of Kerala State after the state’s formation in 1956.

Died

19th March, 1998

Longest Serving Chief Minister of Kerala

E. K. Nayanar was a leader of the CPI(M) party who played a major role in shaping Kerala’s political landscape in early days. Nayanar’s leadership spanned crucial periods in the state’s history. In his term, he particularly focused was on the issues related to social justice and the welfare of the common people.

Born: 9th December, 1919

Party Name: CPI(M)

Total Tenure: 10 years, 353 days

Died: 19th May, 2004

Chief Ministers of Kerala – FAQs

Who was the first serving chief ministers of Kerala?

Sri E. M. S. Namboodiripad and Sri E. K. Nayanar are the first and longest serving chief ministers of Kerala.

Which chief minister established the KSRTC?

Sri E. M. S. Namboodiripad, the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) was established.

How many times President’s Rule were imposed in Kerala till date?

Till now, the President’s rule were imposed in Kerala for 8 times.

Who were the first Dalit and Muslim Chief Ministers of Kerala?

Sri Raman Sankar and Janab C. H. Mohammed Koya, were the first dalit and muslim chief ministers of Kerala.

Who was the shortest serving Chief Minister of Kerala?

Janab C. H. Mohammed Koya was the shortest serving Chief Minister of Kerala.

Who was the youngest and eldest Chief Minister of Kerala till now?

Sri A. K. Antony and Sri Velikkakathu Sankaran Achuthanandan are the youngest and eldest chief minister of Kerala till now.
